website_summaries.verdict: A steady, reliable solar charger for small electronics, though it charges too slowly for some.
pros: Lightweight and portable thanks to its folding storage case
Charges smartphones and small electronic devices well, users report
cons: Charges too slowly for some users, even in direct sunlight
Storage pocket in charger case can hold heat from charging devices stored there

customer_reviews.title: Did not meet my expectations. Used in Puerto Rico ...
customer_reviews.text: Did not meet my expectations. Used in Puerto Rico during power outage and it didn't charge anything I tried connecting to it, mind you it was in direct sunlight.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Low output 4.34W output on a sunny day
customer_reviews.text: Disappointed that the max power in the direct Texas sunlight at 1 PM is 1.1 amps at 3.94 volts bringing watts to a laughable 4.34w For a 21 watt charger this is 1/5 of the advertised output in direct sunlight outdoors. Anker normally corrects their mistakes, I'm willing to change my review if it's a faulty product. Anker sent another so I'm increasing my review a star, however output is the same in direct sunlight on a cloudless day. But with the 2 panels combined it almost makes half the advertised output.
customer_reviews.author: Chris E.

customer_reviews.title: Not good for Siesta4 tent fans!
customer_reviews.text: I am so disappointed in this thing. I bought it for a tent I own which has usb fans that need to turn on when the sun hits the tent to keep it cool so that I can sleep late.So I put the thing out on top of the tent with the fans plugged in and it's working. At night it turns off. So I wakeup, boiling in ny tent with no fans running. It turns out youhave to close it up and re-open it for it to work. Such a crappy design and it's long past my warranty period. Thats a lot of $ wasted!
customer_reviews.author: M. Leigh

customer_reviews.title: Zero output
customer_reviews.text: Plugged into iPhone then into a small portable battery, zero charging on either one of them. It's in full, direct sunlight on a warm day here in Phoenix so that's not the problem. Unfortunately I didn't try to use it until it was out of warranty. This sat in its box in a closet well protected, so it's just like new, no damage, no extreme anything. A complete dud. Make sure if you do buy one, you test it out immediately so it can be exchanged or refunded. Mine was $75 when I ordered it way back when. Serious disappointment. Maybe there's some secret shelf life and mine is past the expiration date.
customer_reviews.author: Oh Yeah

customer_reviews.title: Questionable reliability
customer_reviews.text: Decent charger when working however reliability is questionable. Worked for a couple of weeks, then stopped functioning regardless of degree of sunlight or charging cable being used. LED light no longer came up. Tried "reboot" workaround a previous commenter post but got same outcome. LED does not light up, devices attached do not charge
customer_reviews.author: John Culala

customer_reviews.title: I love Anker but this is a lemon.
customer_reviews.text: I have used other Anker products before and love them. This one i actually got after looking at the difference between this one and a goal zero. But unfortunately it didnt work. The phone stayed at 15% the whole time it was "charging" i wish i could recommend this product especially because i love all the other Anker products that i own but i cant.
customer_reviews.author: Luke

customer_reviews.title: Didn't charge phone which overheated in the sun
customer_reviews.text: Mid-day Florida sun in late May. Phone did beep when I plugged it in and the charging symbol was shown, but a couple of hours later, the phone hadn't charged. However, it displayed an emergency message about overheating. Given that others have noted here that this product isn't terribly water resistant, I really don't understand how this might work. I was hoping to use this as an emergency source during a power outage after a hurricane, but that's clearly not going to happen now.
customer_reviews.author: fotoFloridian

customer_reviews.title: No manual included
customer_reviews.text: It's a bit absurd that there's no instructions, just a useless "welcome guide". I didn't realize I was buying something without a battery bank (so it only charges directly to your phone or a battery bank that you buy in addition to it) nor that I'd have to get a tripod or backpack setup going to have it at a good enough angle to use. Anker makes decent stuff but just because I had to go to YouTube to figure those 3 things out seems a bit janky to me. At the very least, it'd be nice if it came with a setup for standing at whatever angle you want.
customer_reviews.author: Kyle Burris

customer_reviews.title: Good for Charging Small USB Devices
customer_reviews.text: Decent USB device charger. Tested mine on a clear day, it put 8400mAh into a portable USB charger in 5 hours. Gave it 4 stars instead of 5 due to the fact that it never put out more than 1.8 amps, and then only at times. If you plug two devices into it at once you get half the output. Averaged 1.6 to 1.7 amps mostly. Still, plenty for charging a phone or other small device.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hope and Frustration
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to get this product in the mail. However... This product never worked there way it was advertised for me. I've owned it for about 3.5 years and have only achieved a full charge of my cell phone on a single day once. Also, it took me three days to fully charge my portable battery pack. I suspect that I received a defective product.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Strasser

customer_reviews.title: Watch where you buy your products.
customer_reviews.text: MAKE SURE you purchase the product directly from the manufacturer and NOT from a third party 😬 I received the product on time and I immediately opened the box to use it. It worked once and I put it back inside the package for future use. Tried to use it after three weeks and it does not have the red light on and no charge to my different devices even if the solar panel is under direct sunlight for about 3 hours 😁 Had to return and get a refund. Very disappointing 😒
customer_reviews.author: Angelica Rodriguez

customer_reviews.title: yet again an awesome product. for anyone looking for the perfect portable ...
customer_reviews.text: yet again an awesome product. for anyone looking for the perfect portable solar panel this is the one you want. Its so compact like the same of a 13inch macbook but super light. I love the form factor and the output is FANTASTIC. its affordable and its useful. I would recommend buying one of anker's battery packs, they are super nice compact and also carry a large capacity for a good price. use this panel to charge up your batteries and use the batteries to charge your phone. note that you don't want to leave your battery in direct sunlight or get it hot. not waterproof but water resistant
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Yes..yes..yes!!! Backcountry approved
customer_reviews.text: I’ve used this on 4 separate backpacking trips through backcountry; each trip ranging from 3-6 days. I’ve been able to keep a steady charge with this solar panel consistently. Very sturdy, works great, love the pocket where the usb go, u can put phone or cords in while charging... u can even clip to pack while trekking and get a charge that way if your on the move... all in all I’ve had no issues with it.. so worth it
customer_reviews.author: nicole hernandez

customer_reviews.title: Real life saver during Hurricane Matthew
customer_reviews.text: I bought this solar charger in preparation of Hurricane Matthew "in case" the power went out I could still charge phones and tablets. I almost considered sending it back when they forecasted the storm to move away from North Carolina. Glad I didn't, needless to say this solar charger provides the means necessary to keep our cells phones, Verizon tablet, and our child's game tablet charged throughout the event. Every morning I will set it up on the front steps, connect a phone or two (make sure you keep the electronics out of direct light), come back a few hours later and I had a full battery. This is now part of my go bag and tested regularly.
customer_reviews.author: Zack

customer_reviews.title: States in product description that it is for iPhones. ...
customer_reviews.text: States in product description that it is for iPhones. Both our iPhone 6 and 7 give error messages when attached. Called Anker customer support 6 times this morning and was disconnected each time.
customer_reviews.author: JK

customer_reviews.title: DOA?
customer_reviews.text: I put this in direct sun, outdoors, attempting to charge an Anker battery for USB devices. After a couple days, each with maybe 5 hours in direct sun, the battery charge hadn’t improved. I sent feedback to Anker, per instructions, but no response in a few days, so I returned. It may have been defective, or it may be that this device doesn’t work well except in the desert in the summer.
customer_reviews.author: RAD

customer_reviews.title: In Direct Sunlight, Puts Out an Incredible Amount of Power! Very Pleased Using it on Longer, Section-Hikes!
customer_reviews.text: Using this for longer, section-hikes on the Florida Trail and Appalachian Trail. Does a great job of charging my Anker battery brick in less time than I would have guessed. If you get this thing in direct sunlight and plug your iPhone in to charge, you will be AMAZED at how much juice this puts out in a short time. I haven't done precise measurements (You can find that in other reviews here.), but can tell you that you're very likely going to be impressed and amazed at how much juice you will get from a 20-minute lunch stop in a sunny location while backpacking!
customer_reviews.author: Ronald W. HarrisonTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Used this on a Mission Trip to Uganda. Dug ...
customer_reviews.text: Used this on a Mission Trip to Uganda. Dug a well, and charged my power banks and phones every day with this beast. only problem is if it gets cloudy the panel stops working, so you have to close it then open it. Why is this? I have no idea. Learned from someones review on what to do. Legit though, Wish I would be a product tester for Anker! I used over 10 different Anker products in Uganda over the summer, every one was great
customer_reviews.author: Lawcorp

customer_reviews.title: Worked once
customer_reviews.text: Perhaps mine is defective but unfortunately it only worked for a few minutes. I charged it in the sun as soon as it arrived to test it and all was good...it charged my phone. Few months later I took it camping (after pre-charging it at home again) and the light would turn on indicating it had power but it wouldn't charge my device. Since then I've tried periodically without any luck. The size and weight are perfect to take along backpacking/camping but can't recommend based on my experience.
customer_reviews.author: JRB

customer_reviews.title: Great for camping and hiking!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device before I went on a week-long camping trip where we would have no electricity. I was able to keep my phone charged for the whole week! I will admit that the charging speed is really slow, it took almost all day for a full charge. However, it is just a solar panel at the end of the day. I don't know if the product is water-resistant because I always put it away when it rained, it needs sun to charge anyway. I am very happy with my purchase and I recommend this to all of my outdoorsy friends and family.
customer_reviews.author: Luke Koschnick

customer_reviews.title: Power where there is no power
customer_reviews.text: Going out into the field for training, frequently and unexpectedly at times, sometimes you forget to pack a power bank or don't have access to a reliable power source or wall outlet to recharge your electronic devices. This solar panel solves that problem quickly and easily in one little package. It works on partially cloudy days as well but not as powerful as a sunny day. With two charging ports and a sunny day you can charge your phones or another device in about 4-5 hours of uninterrupted charging. Any device that uses a USB charging plug can be charged using its own cords. A great buy.
customer_reviews.author: nathan

customer_reviews.title: An amazing piece of technology, as all things Anker
customer_reviews.text: It outputs about 0.7A even when it was pretty cloudy, at 11am (measured with a USB tester). When the sun shines, the current goes up fast. For Anker: Next time you release a USB solar charger: * Make it capable of withstanding rain (at least light rain), so I don't have to worry if those clouds could turn into rain. * Put 3 USB output ports in it. With 3 amps max output and just two ports, if you're charging small phones you'd be wasting about 1 amp or more under optimal sunlight.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Awesome quality and reasonable price
customer_reviews.text: This is my second anklet 21w solar panel. First one is great. Still going strong. I got this one to keep in my camping gear. I charge my iPhone XS Max no problem. I have used it to charge both at the same time my nitecore f1 charger with 18650 and iPhone XS Max. Seems to still charge on overcast days but not as fast. I wish these could be daisy chained to get her to increase output. Anker!! Please make this with one outlet power delivery and second outlet Qualcomm 3.0!!
customer_reviews.author: TOJE

customer_reviews.title: Reliable and Quick Charging
customer_reviews.text: Took this Solar charger to the lake and within an hour or two, it completely charged my iPhone 7 from a dead battery. Very awesome, and sturdy-feeling design. Was able to take some light beating up, and doesn't show any signs of wear and tear. Will definitely keep this in our camping/emergency supplies.
customer_reviews.author: Scott&AshRamboz

customer_reviews.title: Use it a lot. Best in years.
customer_reviews.text: I’ve had one for, I guess, around 3 years. I use it everyday for months at a time. I’ve product tested for goal zero and Joos. This has outlasted everything I’ve ever tried. In 2002 I soldered small solar panels to rechargeable batteries. I’ve seen this tech evolve. This is a good one. Fast and durable. Best I’ve found.
customer_reviews.author: Adam H.

customer_reviews.title: Works best charging batteries instead of phones/gadgets directly due to the ...
customer_reviews.text: Works best charging batteries instead of phones/gadgets directly due to the nature of the sun not always being constant. Would charge a 1000mh pack in a day of good sun in a semi-shaded area (took to a summer camp for a week) never was without battery life for phone thanks to this. Wish it was more weather rated, good weight though for backpacking if you must charge higher demand things Has 2 usb ports, I couldn't tell the difference, wish the built in pouch area where plugs are has more/better velcro to hold said device while charging. Grommeted holes a plus for hanging though. First real solar charger I have had, don't regret the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan P3 N&R

customer_reviews.title: Shoddy documentation
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't come with much on how to use it or more particular trouble shooting. Apparently mines didn't work right off the bat. We learned from a forum (not by the manufacturer btw) sometimes it needs to be reset so you close the panels for a time open them and wait for the LED to come on red. Than your hook up your item. I came very close returning it thinking it was defective. Over all excellent product, shoddy documentation and support.
customer_reviews.author: jose

customer_reviews.title: Works ok but needs improvement
customer_reviews.text: I’ve been using this for 3 years. The film over the panels has gotten horrible after being in the sun. The fabric is fading and now they are charging almost 3x what I paid for it in 2016. Come on Anker, why???
customer_reviews.author: Josh

customer_reviews.title: But it's better than the one I bought a few years ago ...
customer_reviews.text: Still not sure if the tech is there yet as this thing very slowly charges the smaller iPhone 7, even on a clear day angled directly at the sun. I mainly bought it as a backup for emergency type situations. Maybe something is wrong with it, but it's laughable that it has two USB plugs as you could never charge two things at once—at least with the unit I received. But it's better than the one I bought a few years ago that does jack crap, so I give it an average score. Don't expect to do much with it.
customer_reviews.author: Duke

customer_reviews.title: Reliable, heavy duty solar charger.
customer_reviews.text: I got this solar charger off Anker's official site, they do email deals every now and then so it was cheaper there, and I LOVE this charger. The holes on the sides of the thick, reliable clothlike material that makes up this charger allow for easy mounting. The charger can keep up with a Galaxy S7 after it dropped down to 1% with GPS, wifi, and Bluetooth enabled. If you want a 100% reliable charge though, I'd invest in a small 5000-10000mAh Anker battery pack for your solar panel to always charge, for your use Incase the sun isn't out. I only endorse Anker battery packs due to them commonly having the quick charge/IQ charge options.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Nice gear. I got it this afternoon. Plugged in an iphone SE at 54% at 5PM, with the phone on. I played a game and some other stuff too. By 6:14 the phone was charged to 89%. Not bad for late afternoon sun. I have not tried it with a 2nd device but it would work well. The package is nicely put together, seems sturdy enough and well-designed. The pocket that contains the guts of it includes a usb to micro-usb cable and has room for extra cables or a slim battery bank. Glad I bought it and would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: Just finished testing it.
customer_reviews.text: Just finished testing this 21w solar charger, it charged my 6,500mah battery from empty to full in direct sunlight with partial cloud in exactly 4 hours. So with a little math u can now estimate charging times for different battery sizes. "YOUR WELCOME" 🙂
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good so Far.
customer_reviews.text: Just received this 2 days ago. I am using this for bike touring, and it's main job is to charge my Anker back-up battery. So far it is doing the job well. I have the Anker PowerCore+ 13400 mAh, Model A1315. The panels can easily recharge the back-up battery in a day of full sun, and since I don't actually use much of the battery's power to recharge my phone and my lights every day, this solar charger will easily take care of my 5000 mAh per day needs. It's also light enough and tough enough for bicycle touring. I have some friends on a cross country tour who are using them as well.
customer_reviews.author: TIn Man

customer_reviews.title: Good solid charging panels for emergency or everyday use.
customer_reviews.text: This is great. I love my anker products. The solar charger works very well. I use an anker PowerCore Fusion 5000mAh, Dual Port 2-in-1 Portable Charger and Wall Charger with it to store the charge when I am not charging a flashlight or phone. I hang it on the back of my pack when hiking and charge up the powercore or my phone. They are solar and they do not power up stuff like an outlet at home so expect it to take a little while. I am glad I bought the Anker. I have had no problems with the panels. Its part of my camping and emergency kit at home.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Working with Customer Service.
customer_reviews.text: Update: After posting my review, Anker customer service reached out to me to send me a replacement item. I will test it and update again after I'm sure it's working properly. Original Review: Single use It died after the first time I used it.
customer_reviews.author: MisterSaturn

customer_reviews.title: Works fine, but is heavier than the description says.
customer_reviews.text: The Anker solar panel functions well. However I bought it for backpacking based on the described weight of 14.7 ounces. On my calibrated scale it weighs 17.46 ounces without its included USB charging cable. Hard to believe Anker could get the weight that wrong. 2.76 ounces means a lot to a gram counting backpacking weenie like me. Disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: JRW

customer_reviews.title: Buy a higher Watt One
customer_reviews.text: I don’t recommend it literally needs to be in Direct sunlight to function properly and it’s slow. I can’t even charge my camera batteries with it.
customer_reviews.author: Maddog

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Charges my external battery at a decent pace. For some reason, I wasn’t able to charge my phone. When I went to check my phone, the phone was very hot to touch. Still satisfied though, as it can charge portable batteries.
customer_reviews.author: Adam591

customer_reviews.title: I was skeptical of this product and others like it but I bought this based on other reviews
customer_reviews.text: I was skeptical of this product and others like it but I bought this based on other reviews. Net is, it's a good overall product, lightweight, portable. I noticed that it charges an iPhone SE quickly, about 30-35% battery increase in ~ 1hr. However it's notably slower to charge my Galaxy S7 (about half as fast) but it does work. I was impressed that it charged just fine using a early morning sun, not very powerful, worked well. I haven't used it in coastal saltwater conditions but plan to and expect it to hold up fine. I would recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew J.

customer_reviews.title: Hurricane Irma Power Source :D
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this for use after Hurricane Irma. We lost power for about 3 days. This worked well to keep a battery's charged. Also was able to keep all of our devices charged. Solid feel, really compact.
customer_reviews.author: rprvw

customer_reviews.title: Poor charging in the midwest
customer_reviews.text: Doesn't really charge my little battery packs even though the light is on. I can have it out for days and my phone won't even get a 75% charge. Would probably be great in the desert, but not worth bringing anywhere that I go. I don't even bother bringing it car camping where weight isn't an issue.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Great charger but may be too heavy for short outings
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this solar charger (Anker 21W Dual USB) to use on an 8-day backcountry camping trip. I tested it at home to make sure it was going to work and it is great. I also worked well on the camping trip but I wonder if one might be better off just taking enough portable chargers if you are going to be gone for less than a couple of weeks. The portable charges would probably be lighter. However, if one is going to be out for weeks, this thing would be worth its weight in gold.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Arkansas

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working after 4 uses. No support from Anker. I will no longer buy Anker products.
customer_reviews.text: Stopped working after 4 uses. I took excellent care of this solar panel, kept it in storage when not in use. I only brought it out for camping trips. I tried to use it once more last week for a camping trip, had it in full mid day direct sunlight, and it no longer works. The LED didn't turn on, and no power came from either port. Anker says the warranty is expired so they won't do anything. I have purchased MANY products from Anker, because I thought they were a quality company who would stand behind reliable products. Apparently that is not the case.
customer_reviews.author: skunther

customer_reviews.title: This charger provided power when I needed it the most
customer_reviews.text: I live in Puerto Rico, and I bought this solar charger on September 5th, 2017. On September 20th we were hit by hurricane Maria, which left the whole island without electrical power. This charger got me through the 2 weeks I didn't have power, and I was able to charge my phone and partially charge my 20Ah Anker battery every day. After we got power back I stored the charger somewhere in the closet and forgot about it. Now in 2018 there are some storms getting close to Puerto Rico again, so I decided it was time to get the charger out of storage, I'm really happy it still works!
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: I can charge both cellphone and headlamp at same time and fairly quickly
customer_reviews.text: I pair this charger with my Petzl rechargeable head lamps. That is a combination everyone should have in their house and car emergency kits. We use it as a backup energy source to my car charger. If ever stranded and out of gas, this charger will charge my cell phone and head lamp. I never leave home with out it. I did quite a bit of research and found that the Anker solar charger was considered the best. It is durable, chargers devices quickly and is very portable, I like it so well that I hope to buy another to keep in my house.
customer_reviews.author: Me

customer_reviews.title: (it looks like a hard panel ) IT IS is a FLAT ...
customer_reviews.text: This was an experiment and bought sight unseen. It NOT what it appears to be in the photo!!!(it looks like a hard panel ) IT IS is a FLAT TRI-FOLD PAD. A BETTER DESCRIPTION OF THE PRODUCT IS NEEDED AND SHOWN HOW IT ACTUALLY FOLDS UP!!! I now just keep it on the dashboard of my car charging all of the time and ready for an emergency little charge system.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product, and great customer support
customer_reviews.text: Charges iPhones well, iPads ok, and charging blocks poorly. For the bulk and dual ports I was hoping for more out of this solar charger. *UPDATE* After I wrote this review, Anker contacted me to help me troubleshoot the original charger before offering to send me a new one free of charge. The new charger works great, and Anker's customer support is great!
customer_reviews.author: SH

customer_reviews.title: Bring your USB charged stuff off of the grid. Easy.
customer_reviews.text: I paired this charger with the EasyACC 26000 battery, and have brought all of my USB charged stuff off of the power grid as a result. This solar charger is solid, and does that which is advertised. I can charge the battery brick in a day of good sun, and it takes days to drain under heavy usage (charging AA, AAA, phone, LED lighting, vape batteries, etc.). Buy this little USB solar charger, charge your brick battery of choice, and take a small -yet meaningful- step into energy independence.
customer_reviews.author: Scotty in Southtown

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend. Light weight for the duties it can perform
customer_reviews.text: Not a "technical" review. I live in Seattle. Recent sunny day (no clouds, 90F all day long). My Samsung Galaxy S5 was at about 25%. I was on a 50km bike ride. Stopped in the shade, put the charger in the sun and plugged in the phone. Took a 2 hour nap. Phone charged to 100%. I see no issues with this item. Highly recommend. Light weight for the duties it can perform. I can say this, it is definitely part of my survival pack. Looking to purchase another one soon.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff

customer_reviews.title: Good product, but quirky.
customer_reviews.text: Not always reliable, but when it works, it works well. The reliability isn't with whether or not there's enough sunlight, but rather whether or not the iPad/iPhone accepts it as a charger - the primary purpose for the purchase. If I completely power down the device to be charged, it appears to do a better job of charging that device. When the device is on, even "asleep" it occasionally refuses to let the solar charger charge it.
customer_reviews.author: robk64

customer_reviews.title: This did nothing...
customer_reviews.text: I just came back from a 3 day camping trip. We tried using this product in direct strong sunlight and after several hours we did not get any battery charge on either my Samsung S8+ or my girl's Apple 6s. I wish I could return it, but it is 4 days shy of the 30 day return period. ARG!
customer_reviews.author: JSNV

customer_reviews.title: Great Solar Charger.  Anker quality!
customer_reviews.text: Love this solar charger! Camped off the grid for 15 days with this thing. Used a Nitecore F1 mini charger, and a batch of 18650 batteries. Plus two 7500 mah USB Honeycomb smart USB batteries. Kept me going. Hung this baby on my tent facing the sun when we left camp in the morning. Switch sides in the afternoon, and swapped out batteries. Worked like a charm. I used this system to keep an iPad, Samsung Note 5, and all my batteries topped off. With a good sun, I was able to refill a completely empty 750 mah USB battery in about a day. Not bad eh?
customer_reviews.author: BradWorld

customer_reviews.title: Not sturdy enough for outside use. Wha?!
customer_reviews.text: Whoops. Couldn't stand up to 1 day in Maine. Oh well.
customer_reviews.author: jim iannone

customer_reviews.title: It worked great and charges the block much faster than I'd have ...
customer_reviews.text: This puppy charges fast! Now having said that, if I plug my phone into it directly my phone loses charge more rapidly than if I just set it down unplugged (Galaxy S8 Active) but I use a battery charging block to charge my phone, then charge that block with this solar charger. It worked great and charges the block much faster than I'd have expected. It's light and I like how it folds up cleanly.
customer_reviews.author: JJ

customer_reviews.title: High output, slightly bulky but is expected. Quality solar panel, very tough.
customer_reviews.text: Comparing to the smaller version, this one delivers enough output to charge almost all devices. The only device this thing might not charge is Microsoft Surface Pro 3. It is always a good idea put a Anker battery in the solar charger's pouch and have it charged during the day. And then use the battery to charge the ipad afterwards at night. Bought it as a donation to a tibetan place where electricity is a problem.
customer_reviews.author: WaltP

customer_reviews.title: Great for Camping and Road Trips
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for camping and road travel to keep electronics charged. I tried it out on a camping trip in 2017 and even in partial shade it charged my smartphone enough to keep the charge level at full despite texting. I haven't experimented with it enough to know how well it will work charging a dead phone, but my phone kept pinging while attached to the charger, notifying me that it was charging/not charging repeatedly.
customer_reviews.author: Amy K. Jones

customer_reviews.title: a really handy item but it is NOT a battery (in case you are confused)
customer_reviews.text: I am going to use this when I go camping to keep my phone topped up. I was confused at first b/c the solar charger does not hold power like a battery does. But it's right in the name of the item - it is a charger not a battery for storing power. No matter, it works very well and I'm glad I got it.
customer_reviews.author: Claire L. Ramsey

customer_reviews.title: Dual usb ports on the panel is useful for charging multiple devices
customer_reviews.text: Powered all my electronics for one week in the bwca with a 20000 MAh usb battery pack. Dual usb ports on the panel is useful for charging multiple devices. Cons not water proof, I've seen a few youtube videos were they put this thing to the test and compared it to other top brands and this surpassed the other brands
customer_reviews.author: slimm008

customer_reviews.title: portable power is awesome
customer_reviews.text: I have the solar charger for a few years now. it still works . . . small devices, fone or tablet. It says on many devices and charging systems "Do not have device in direct sunlight while charging." I would take this very seriously, the device will get very hot and could cause a battery failure (meaning a leaking battery and ruin the device or cause injury.
customer_reviews.author: Stegmon Weirdt

customer_reviews.title: Durable
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be well constructed. Bought it to charge phones & tablet when power goes out due to severe storms. The only thing I wish it had was some way to hang it from a post or stand. May have to add a strap to it. Does work best in full sunlight and it is American made.
customer_reviews.author: J B

customer_reviews.title: Never lack battery for my devices! Anker keeps the #PowerOn
customer_reviews.text: Definitely love Anker products! I've been using the Anker 21W Solar Charger out in the deserts in Arizona on my camping/hiking trip and works great! I also purchased the PowerCore 26800. I never have a lack of power for any of my devices as I backpack around the world! I have used this to charge Samsung Galaxy, HTC Desire, GoPro dual batteries, Kindles and battery packs! Highly recommend Anker! They will keep your #PowerOn !
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel J

customer_reviews.title: Inconsistent?
customer_reviews.text: Charges Ok. But when shadows cross the panels the Amps drop and never recover when the sun returns. Might be the device I'm charging's fault or issue. I'm charging the Anker 26,800. I've read others with this issue too. Pretty useless if your're trying to do long charges over many hrs and it gets stuck at .5 amps. *sigh*
customer_reviews.author: Helius

customer_reviews.title: Not what’s it’s supposed to be
customer_reviews.text: Stops working in the sun. I tried to keep it on my dashboard to charge my phone. After it stops you have to cool it off for 10 or 15 minutes before it works again. I bought 2 both do the same thing
customer_reviews.author: joseph iuliucci

customer_reviews.title: Portable and charges well.
customer_reviews.text: I am thrilled at how well this works. Using it to charge a battery pack to charge my phone whenever, regardless if its sunny or not. Worth the money for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Thirteen

customer_reviews.title: I hope I never have to use this!
customer_reviews.text: I keep this in my car because if you've ever been on the side of the road with a dead car with no charge on your phone you don't make that same mistake twice. Now I've got battery backups and this little beaut, No more stranded for hours for me!
customer_reviews.author: Chris J. Watson

customer_reviews.title: Device gets hot while being in sun. needs reflective pocket to sheild.
customer_reviews.text: Update #1 Charged today in backyard, Galaxy S5 went from 64% to 84% in about 1 hour. Maybe shorter but when I went to check, the phone said "charging stopped due to high temperature" the phone was in the pocket of the solar panel and was indeed burning hot from being in the sun....this thing needs reflective material on it instead of being black. Actually, the whole thing needs to be reflective instead of hot black. Time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Jakobe

customer_reviews.title: good product thus far
customer_reviews.text: So far this seems to be a really great product. I accidentally abused it within minutes of taking it out of the box. I took it in the backyard and set it up while I was doing some yard work. When a sudden gust of wind came up and picked up my work table and through it and all of its contents into a mud puddle. I let the mud dry and wiped it off after a couple of days and the solar panel seems to work just fine. That's a good sign of durability I guess. Why are you putting those in my pocket
customer_reviews.author: Resistance Cipher Movie Company

customer_reviews.title: Does not charge.  it deplete instead
customer_reviews.text: Just opened the box and took it out side and it charge 1% in 2 hours 60% battery. Then check it in another hour and it depleted the battey 10% while still in full sun with the red light on. Do not buy waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: levi

customer_reviews.title: The construction of this foldable panel exceeds that of my ...
customer_reviews.text: The construction of this foldable panel exceeds that of my Instapark Mercury27 27 Watts Solar Battery Charger; it is of high quality and tight tolerances. I was able to get 5.11V x 1.7A = 8.67W out of this panel in the low mid-day sun on 12/26/2015, sitting in the bed of my truck, charging a RAVPower Portable Charger 6700mAh External Battery Pack. It is yet to be seen what this panel will output in the full mid-day sun of summer. I think it is realistic to expect to get 14-15W of actual power out of a panel rated at 20W so if I get that, it's a win!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph M. Tyson, Jr.

customer_reviews.title: This was a great purchase. It quickly charges my iphone 6+ and ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a great purchase. It quickly charges my iphone 6+ and gps at the same time when conditions are optimal (sunny with sun directly overhead). Charging times increase of course with the sun lower on the horizon - keeping the panels perpendicular to the sunlight helps. Happy I went with the 21w version. I bought the Anker 20000mah powercore to go with this solar charger. It can fully charge my powercore in a summer day if conditions are ideal and you occassionally reorient the charger.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J Hentgen

customer_reviews.title: Works great!
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic! Was able to fully charge my IPhone X in about ~5 hours in somewhat cloudy skies .
customer_reviews.author: Danny

customer_reviews.title: great for backpacking
customer_reviews.text: Took this backpacking and it worked great. Even when charging in the late afternoon (summer in the Sierra Nevada's) when the sun was lower in the sky it would effectively charge 2 iphones. I did not keep exact track of the time but I would estimate it charged one device from less than 50% to 100% in less than 1 hour. It was durable and could either be stored along the spine of my pack inside or attached to the outside for charging while hiking. I an definitely pleased with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: jojo

customer_reviews.title: Didn't work. Left it out on 2 bright sunny ...
customer_reviews.text: Didn't work. Left it out on 2 bright sunny days at about hrs per day. It did not charge my anker powerbank at all.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not Work as Description
customer_reviews.text: The charging Watt is not as description even under the clear sunshine. It once does not work at all under the clear sunshine. The LED indicator is not working at that time. Finally, it was returned.
customer_reviews.author: Oscar

customer_reviews.title: Anker Is God
customer_reviews.text: All features are TRUE. Mine got horrible treatment from hurricane María in Puerto Rico since back from September 2017 and after more than one year it is still alive and kicking like new. Only thing left for this product to be perfect is to be officially certified waterproof for among other things the purpose of one's peace of mind when it is left outside without supervision and the purpose of free care washability. Did you hear that Anker? Washability as “easy to wash” or “wash without care of damage”, take my advice, you'll hit gold.
customer_reviews.author: CitoCaribbean

customer_reviews.title: Fast, Light, Small
customer_reviews.text: Had to buy a new charging cord for my iPhone since this isn't compatible with the cords Apple makes, but now it works great and charges super fast. Glad I went with this solar charger, even if I had to get the new cord.
customer_reviews.author: KEN

customer_reviews.title: Works great in full sun, pocket is a bit small
customer_reviews.text: Works great in full sun. Understandably slow in partial sun but it's a small, fairly inexpensive solar panel so you really can't expect better. The pocket is too small for an iPhone 11 in a case. Would be 5 stars if the pocket was a bit bigger and zippered.
customer_reviews.author: Wham

customer_reviews.title: The smart-IQ charge feature is generally useful when charging LiON batteries
customer_reviews.text: The smart-IQ charge feature is generally useful when charging LiON batteries, phones, tablets, etc. But it causes problems when charging NiMH batteries which trigger the reset constantly. Would be nice if the feature could be disabled with a switch or provide one USB port without it. Was not typically able to draw 10 watts even when charging two devices each capable of 5w each (iPhone and Anker battery pack) in direct sunlight in California summer. Very nice otherwise: light, compact and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: B. Talbot

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely no way this is 21w
customer_reviews.text: Too 6 hours to charge an iPad mini from 9% to 47% on a clear day in full sunlight.
customer_reviews.author: Gabriel B.

customer_reviews.title: This is NOT a 21 Watt Output Solar Panel
customer_reviews.text: I measured the output at noon on a clear sunny day. I was able to pull 8.5 Watts outta the units before they fell on their faces. I bought two units, they each put out only 8.5 Watts MAX
customer_reviews.author: Mike Folgers

customer_reviews.title: Awesome.
customer_reviews.text: The Anker solar charger is awesome. I've used enough to let my opinion say, it a great product. I do prefer you to get an additional USB wire but that is optional. The good: it's compact and I carried it with me almost every to charge my phone and tablet. The material and design is great. The bad: so far I cannot find anything beside the inside pocket should of secure better by having the velcro cover the whole pocket instead a 1 inch velcro. Overall I'll definitely purchasing another one for backup and recommended to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Shepherd King

customer_reviews.title: Does not charge.
customer_reviews.text: Had it in direct sunlight for days. My battery pack was blinking that showed it was charging but it never showed any result in charging. At least I was able to return it for a refund.
customer_reviews.author: Froggy

customer_reviews.title: There was one time where it charged my Iphone 7 super fast, and I thought I figured out the ...
customer_reviews.text: I have tried this several times in the nicest days, I have tried it several time on cloudy days. Out of about 50 tries it has worked twice. There was one time where it charged my Iphone 7 super fast, and I thought I figured out the product, then the next time it just doesn't work. I am not sure what the problem is, but I would not buy this product again.
customer_reviews.author: Miles

customer_reviews.title: Awesome fast charger
customer_reviews.text: This charger charged my phone from 13% to 100 in just over an hour. Very light and durable and easy to pack. Highly recommend this product for anyone that needs to charge phones or battery packs from the sun.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Anker solves my life's minor power issues from uptown to downtown and from BFE to the Backcountry
customer_reviews.text: I used to rely on a competitors "name brand" solar charger. That simple statement should say enough however since discovering this Anker 21W I am sold completely, better features, better power output, better storage solution and more reliable. If that weren't enough my overall customer service experiences with Anker have sold me on the quality of this company overall.
customer_reviews.author: StockNorth86

customer_reviews.title: This thing is pretty cool
customer_reviews.text: This thing is super powerful and durable. Took it backpacking, but it was more than I really needed and took up a fair bit of space, so now I'm storing it with my emergency preparedness gear instead. I don't backpack for long enough durations to warrant more than an Anker battery pack.
customer_reviews.author: LG5578

customer_reviews.title: Great bright ok cloudy
customer_reviews.text: It really does work well I have not tried it by charging two items at the same time but when I charge one it seems to charge a little bit slower than they wall outlet but it does just the right amount of energy for my phone to charge during the day. I have been using it for a while on cloudy days no it will not even manage to really put up much energy into your phone but it will help enough to not reduce it.
customer_reviews.author: forest88

customer_reviews.title: Only 15 Watts - 3 Amp at 5 volt.
customer_reviews.text: ONLY a 15 Watt charger. two 5v USB ports but Anker state only 3 AMP max output. that is 15 Watts. the smaller 15W model has a max output of 2.1 amp (11 watts). The thing works and maybe you get 15 watt from the 21 watt cells at bad angles with the sun. if you need 20 watts or 4Amps of power this is not enough.
customer_reviews.author: Larry Holub

customer_reviews.title: Great charger!
customer_reviews.text: In the Army and have used this thing for the past 14 days with 17 more to go. It has gotten slightly wet, dirty, and scratched. Still works just fine. I have zero complaints so far. I recommend that you only charge power banks with this solar panel. It will save you trouble.
customer_reviews.author: Mack

customer_reviews.title: Will not acknowledge an iPhone 5S
customer_reviews.text: I purposefully purchased a solar charger to charge my iPhone and the phone will not accept or acknowledge the charger. Has anyone else had this problem? is there some gimmick that is on the market to make this work? I used the apple supplied cord to connect the charger and still no luck...
customer_reviews.author: JohnC

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for backpacking and powering my Camera
customer_reviews.text: stopped working after 5 months of use. it worked well when it was working. stopped working while was out in the trail. I used this to power my camera and phone while backpacking. UPDATE- Anker contacted me right away and shipped me a brand new solar charger. Updating my rating to 5 stars just based on customer service my positive experience with other Anker products.
customer_reviews.author: ricardo dabatos

customer_reviews.title: Best gift idea, quality, and customer service.
customer_reviews.text: DOES what it says. And customer service does the EXACT same(.) Let me tell you, I got three of these. First two perfect, strong, durable, waterproof. For whatever reason one arrived defective. They did not hesitate, to replace. I run a company now and it's essential I remain off grid power wise. I charge my phone, batt bank, and vape battery w the greatest of ease finally. If you hate wall outlets as much as me. Buy it. Perfect gift idea too. You can see my public ig posts @resination
customer_reviews.author: mimm

customer_reviews.title: Works As Expected, Best Bang For The Buck
customer_reviews.text: I'm going to be using this in June for 2 weeks in the field. I got it yesterday and threw it in my car plugged into my 5000mah wireless HDD. Just before roughly 2 hours I was sitting at a 54% charge from completely dead. I just need to find another newer 26000mah powerbank to roll with this and I'll be golden! Amazing solar panel and I love it. It hooks great into the molle on my backpack so I can either lay my bag out in the sun or hike with it. I even bought a package of mixed sized usb cables to give me some charging length.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Van Watermeulen

customer_reviews.title: Works very well, under the right conditions
customer_reviews.text: Finally got a chance to really test this out. Laying out on a bush under mostly sunny skies, it charged my phone about 5% after 15 minutes. Product is very well made and does what I expected it to. Given the right conditions and patience you should be able to get enough of a charge when you need it.
customer_reviews.author: WanderLust

customer_reviews.title: Defective? Mine don't work.
customer_reviews.text: First review just wanted to pass along this product dies not charge my battery pack which is also a Anker. Have tried mutilple time left out all day and nothing. Complete waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony S

customer_reviews.title: Great back country charger
customer_reviews.text: I backpack this solar charger to support my USB devices when I go deep in the forests. It folds flat and I carry it in my pack. It charges the items easily and quickly when I get some sunshine for it. I even recharge my portable batteries with it. Talk about being "off-the-grid".
customer_reviews.author: Jim Hogg

customer_reviews.title: Good buy! I like it. It works, Easy.
customer_reviews.text: It works as described, I charge it on my balcony. I use it to charge my RAVpower power bank. It takes all day in full sun to charge the power bank (vs 4 hours on an outlet) and the bank will then charge my phone from 5% to 100% battery up 4 times. It is awesome, and I can't wait to take it camping!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: In the army, used this multiple times in the ...
customer_reviews.text: In the army, used this multiple times in the field and no complaints. Has saved the day multiple times. Wouldnt suggest it to charge a power bank but for phones and small electronics it works great
customer_reviews.author: Michael Hood

customer_reviews.title: Best Charger Yet I Bought Two!
customer_reviews.text: I was looking for a charger to use when I would go camping for extended periods of time and I've had solar batteries and battery packs but all of them would not charge or quit charging after a couple uses. But as soon as I took my first one on a trip it was the best thing I've seen. Everyone was asking were they could get theirs. But I ended up losing it and really liked it so I bought another one and ended up finding my other one in my bag. Well worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: Dane Friederich

customer_reviews.title: It works
customer_reviews.text: Let me start by saying this has only been tested in my backyard up until this point. I purchased the panel with the intent of using it on the JMT, unfortunately our fires canceled the trip. I tested the panel during daylight hours with some Smokey skies, it still charged three large power banks to full. No problems here, just a little large for backpacking.
customer_reviews.author: Professor84

product_meta.title: Solar Panel, Anker 21W 2-Port USB Portable Solar Charger with Foldable Panel, PowerPort Solar for iPhone 11/Xs/XS Max/XR/X/8/7, iPad Pro/Air/Mini, Galaxy S9/S8/S7/S6, and More
product_meta.description: The Anker advantage: join the fast charging technology. The Anker advantage: join the fast charging technology.
feature_bullets: The Anker Advantage: Join the 50 million+ powered by our leading technology

Fast Charging Technology: PowerIQ delivers the charging speed up to 2.4 amps per port or 3 amps overall under direct sunlight. 21 watt SunPower solar array is 21.5-23.5% efficient, providing enough power to charge two devices simultaneously
Incredibly Durable: Industrial-strength PET polymer faced solar panels sewn into a rugged polyester canvas offer weather-resistant outdoor durability

Highly Portable: Compact size (11.1 × 6.3in folded or 26.4 × 11.1in opened) and stainless-steel eye-holes on each corner allow easy attachment to backpacks, trees, or tents. Lightweight and ultra-thin design make it ideal for long treks
What You Get: Anker PowerPort Solar (21W 2-Port USB Solar Charger), 3ft Micro USB cable, welcome guide, our fan-favorite 18-month warranty and friendly customer service

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.3 out of 5 stars2,316 ratings4.3 out of 5 stars
